  • public class InPartOfBoard
extends BasicCondition
    Class representing an in-subrange condition
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

    • Constructor Detail

      • InPartOfBoard

        public InPartOfBoard(int programLevel,
             Robot robot,
             Position position1,
             Position position2)
        Initializes this in-subrange condition with the given program level, robot and positions.
        Parameters:
        programLevel - The program level of this new in-subrange condition.
        robot - The robot of this new in-subrange condition.
        position1 - The first position of this new in-subrange condition.
        position2 - The second position of this new in-subrange condition.

      • InPartOfBoard

        public InPartOfBoard(int programLevel,
             Robot robot,
             long[] coordinates)
        Initializes this in-subrange condition with the given program level, robot and coordinates. The given list of coordinates represent two positions with coordinates (x,y) These positions will be (coordinates[0], coordinates[1]) and (coordinates[2], coordinates[3]).
        Parameters:
        programLevel - The program level of this new in-subrange condition.
        robot - The robot of this new in-subrange condition.
        coorinates - The couple (coordinates[0], coordinates[1]) should represent the (x,y) coordinates of the first position The couple (coordinates[2], coordinates[3]) should represent the (x,y) coordinates of the second position

    • Method Detail

      • getRobot

        public Robot getRobot()
        Returns the robot of this in-subrange condition.

      • getPosition1

        public Position getPosition1()
        Returns the first position of this in-subrange condition.

      • getPosition2

        public Position getPosition2()
        Returns the second position of this in-subrange condition.

      • results

        public boolean results()
        Returns the result of this in-subrange condition. This will be true if the robot of this condition is placed between the rectangle formed by the two positions of the condition.
        Specified by:
        results in class BasicCondition

      • results

        public boolean results(Element element)
        Returns the result of this true condition, given the given element. This will be true if the given element is placed between the rectangle formed by the two positions of the condition.
        Specified by:
        results in class BasicCondition
        Parameters:
        element - The element on who the result will depend
        Returns:
        ... | result == ((element.getPosition().getCoordX() >= this.getPosition1().getCoordX()) && (element.getPosition().getCoordX() <= this.getPosition2().getCoordX())) | || ((element.getPosition().getCoordX() <= this.getPosition1().getCoordX()) && (element.getPosition().getCoordX() >= this.getPosition2().getCoordX()))

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of this in-subrange condition.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getNotationExample

        public java.lang.String getNotationExample()
        String representation of this in-subrange condition, in the syntax used by the Parser.
        Specified by:
        getNotationExample in class BasicCondition
        Returns:
        ... | result == "(in-subrange 'X1-number', 'Y1-number', 'X2-number', 'Y2-number')"
